components.description: The Liferay Faces Alloy facelet component tags with the alloy: tag name prefix.

function.description: Returns an escaped representation of the specified client ID.
Returns the client ID associated with the specified expression.

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the css style of the element.
attribute.name: style

attribute.description: The name of a CSS class that is to be rendered within the class attribute.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: The key name that can be used to reference the component on the client.
attribute.name: clientKey

component.name: Button
component.description: Button is a UIOutput component that renders a styleable HTML <button> element. The default type is button. Since it extends HtmlOutcomeTargetButton it supports all the features of h:button. The component does not need to be a child of h:form since the outcome attribute is designed to navigate via HTTP GET.

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying whether or not the component should automatically recieve focus on the initial page load.
attribute.name: autofocus

attribute.description: When this flag is true, the component will be disabled, and the user will be unable to intercat with the component.
attribute.name: disabled

attribute.description: The type of the button: button (default), submit, or reset.
attribute.name: type

attribute.description: A list of tokens separated by spaces that specify the various WAI-ARIA roles that this component is used by.
attribute.name: role

attribute.description: When this flag is true, view parameters (specified via f:viewParam tags) will be included on the navigation URL
attribute.name: includeViewParams

attribute.description: A string which potentially matches the value of from-outcome key in a navigation-case.
attribute.name: outcome

attribute.description: A hot key character that makes it possible for the user to change focus to this component
attribute.name: accesskey

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying alternative information about the rendered HTML element.
attribute.name: alt

attribute.description: Designates the reading direction for the attribute. For example, right to left (RTL), or left to right (LTR).
attribute.name: dir

attribute.description: A fragment to be appended to the navigation URL.
attribute.name: fragment

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: Specifies the URL of an image.
attribute.name: image

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the language code used in this element.
attribute.name: lang

attribute.description: Javascript to execute after this component loses focus.
attribute.name: onblur

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when this component is clicked.
attribute.name: onclick

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a double click event occurs.
attribute.name: ondblclick

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when this component gets focus.
attribute.name: onfocus

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a keydown event occurs.
attribute.name: onkeydown

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a keypress event occurs.
attribute.name: onkeypress

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a keyup event occurs.
attribute.name: onkeyup

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mousedown event occurs.
attribute.name: onmousedown

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mousemove event occurs.
attribute.name: onmousemove

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mouseout event occurs.
attribute.name: onmouseout

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mouseover event occurs.
attribute.name: onmouseover

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mouseup event occurs.
attribute.name: onmouseup

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value of this attribute is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: An integer designating the position in the tabbing order for this component among others, if any.
attribute.name: tabindex

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the title of the element.
attribute.name: title

attribute.description: The value of this component.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: When this flag is true, the client window param will not be inlcuded on the navigation URL. Note: the ClientWindow feature is disabled by default, so this attribute will have no effect unless ClientWindow is enabled.
attribute.name: disableClientWindow

component.name: CharCounter
component.description: CharCounter is an OutputText component that displays the number of allowed characters remaining for a given text input, and limits the number of characters allowed in the input. Renders as HtmlOutputText renders, so this tag will optionally render a span when i18n or style attributes used.

attribute.description: The id of the text input node which is used to calculate the remaining characters. One of either "for" or "input" are required.
attribute.name: for

attribute.description: Node or Selector to display the number of remaining characters calculated by the charCounter.
attribute.name: counter

attribute.description: Input text node which will have it's number of characters limited by the charCounter. One of either "for" or "input" are required.
attribute.name: input

attribute.description: Node or Selector to display the number of remaining characters calculated by the charCounter.
attribute.name: onMaxlengthReached

attribute.description: Node or Selector to display the number of remaining characters calculated by the charCounter.
attribute.name: onceMaxlengthReached

component.name: CommandButton
component.description: CommandButton is a UICommand component that renders a styleable HTML <button> element. The default type is submit. Since it extends HtmlCommandButton it supports all the features of h:commandButton. The component must be a child of h:form in order to trigger the action or actionListener.

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying whether or not the component should automatically recieve focus on the initial page load.
attribute.name: autofocus

attribute.description: When this flag is true, the component will be disabled, and the user will be unable to intercat with the component.
attribute.name: disabled

attribute.description: The type of the button: button, submit (default), or reset.
attribute.name: type

attribute.description: A list of tokens separated by spaces that specify the various WAI-ARIA roles that this component is used by.
attribute.name: role

attribute.description: A method that is executed when this component is clicked. The method must be public, return an Object, and take no arguments. The toString() method of the returned object is used to determine where to navigate (if at all) after the action has been performed.
attribute.name: action

attribute.description: A method that is executed when this component is clicked. The method must be public, return void, and take either no arguments or one ActionEvent argument.
attribute.name: actionListener

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component's value must be converted and validated (immediately) during the Apply Request Values phase, instead of (later) during the PROCESS_VALIDATIONS phase.
attribute.name: immediate

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value of this attribute is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: The value of this component
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: A hot key character that makes it possible for the user to change focus to this component
attribute.name: accesskey

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying alternative information about the rendered HTML element.
attribute.name: alt

attribute.description: Designates the reading direction for the attribute. For example, right to left (RTL), or left to right (LTR).
attribute.name: dir

attribute.description: Specifies the URL of an image.
attribute.name: image

attribute.description: A name for this component to be rendered to the user. This name should be localized for the user.
attribute.name: label

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the language code used in this element.
attribute.name: lang

attribute.description: Javascript to execute after this component loses focus.
attribute.name: onblur

attribute.description: Javascript to execute after this component's value has changed, and then it loses focus.
attribute.name: onchange

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when this component is clicked.
attribute.name: onclick

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a double click event occurs.
attribute.name: ondblclick

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when this component gets focus.
attribute.name: onfocus

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a keydown event occurs.
attribute.name: onkeydown

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a keypress event occurs.
attribute.name: onkeypress

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a keyup event occurs.
attribute.name: onkeyup

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mousedown event occurs.
attribute.name: onmousedown

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mousemove event occurs.
attribute.name: onmousemove

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mouseout event occurs.
attribute.name: onmouseout

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mouseover event occurs.
attribute.name: onmouseover

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mouseup event occurs.
attribute.name: onmouseup

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when the user selects this component.
attribute.name: onselect

attribute.description: When true, this causes an attribute to be rendered as readonly="readonly", and prevents the user from changing the value of this component.
attribute.name: readonly

attribute.description: An integer designating the position in the tabbing order for this component among others, if any.
attribute.name: tabindex

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the title of the element.
attribute.name: title

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

component.name: DatePicker
component.description: Pops up a calendar with selectable dates when its trigger is clicked.

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: The format of the date that corresponds to patterns described in the javadoc for java.text.SimpleDateFormat.
attribute.name: datePattern

attribute.description: The id of the component that the datePicker will be triggered by. If trigger is specified, this value is unused.
attribute.name: for

attribute.description: Used to determine the format fo the date unless the datePattern is specified. The locale of the datePicker.
attribute.name: locale

attribute.description: The maximum date that can be selected by the user.
attribute.name: maximumDate

attribute.description: The minimum date that can be selected by the user.
attribute.name: minimumDate

attribute.description: Specifies the date selection style. Valid values include single (the default), multiple, or multiple-sticky.
attribute.name: selectionMode

attribute.description: The fully-qualified id of the element that triggers the calendar popup. Please consider using the for attribute instead.
attribute.name: trigger

attribute.description: Specifies the stack order of the calendar popup. When running in Liferay Portal, the value of Liferay.zIndex.TOOLTIP is the default.
attribute.name: zIndex

component.name: Icon
component.description: Icon is a component that renders a span which contains an icon specified by the name attribute.

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: The icon which this component will render. A list of valid icons can be found at Bootstrap Base CSS. Note: icon names must be specified without the icon- prefix.
attribute.name: name

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value of this attribute is true.
attribute.name: rendered

component.name: InputDate
component.description: InputDate is a UIInput component that renders a textbox and a popup a calendar with selectable dates. The component attepts to automatically convert the submitted value to a Date via a built in DateTimeConverter.

attribute.description: The format of the date that corresponds to patterns described in the javadoc for java.text.SimpleDateFormat.
attribute.name: datePattern

attribute.description: Used to determine the format fo the date unless the datePattern is specified. The locale of the datePicker.
attribute.name: locale

attribute.description: The maximum date that can be selected by the user.
attribute.name: maximumDate

attribute.description: The minimum date that can be selected by the user.
attribute.name: minimumDate

attribute.description: The number of month panes shown in the popup calendar. Valid values are 1 (the default), 2, and 3.
attribute.name: panes

attribute.description: Specifies which event will pop up the calendar. Valid values are focus (the default), button, and both.
attribute.name: showOn

attribute.description: Specifies the stack order of the calendar popup. When running in Liferay Portal, the value of Liferay.zIndex.TOOLTIP is the default.
attribute.name: zIndex

component.name: AceEditor
component.description: InputSourceCode is an input component that renders a field for editing source code text.

attribute.description: When this flag is true, the component will be disabled, and the user will be unable to intercat with the component.
attribute.name: disabled

attribute.description: When this flag is true, and a value has not been specified for this component, then the PROCESS_VALIDATIONS phase will fail and a FacesMessage will be added to the FacesContext for this component.
attribute.name: required

attribute.description: The value of this component, which is typically bound via EL to a model bean property.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: A hot key character that makes it possible for the user to change focus to this component
attribute.name: accesskey

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying alternative information about the rendered HTML element.
attribute.name: alt

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying whether autocomplete is turned on or off for the rendered HTML element. Valid values include on (default) and off.
attribute.name: autocomplete

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: The class name of the converter instance that is to be used by this component.
attribute.name: converter

attribute.description: This message or the result of the specified expression, will be used as the text of the converter message instead of any message that comes from the registered converter for this component.
attribute.name: converterMessage

attribute.description: Designates the reading direction for the attribute. For example, right to left (RTL), or left to right (LTR).
attribute.name: dir

attribute.description: When this flag is true, the component will be disabled, and the user will be unable to intercat with the component.
attribute.name: disabled

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component's value must be converted and validated (immediately) during the Apply Request Values phase, instead of (later) during the PROCESS_VALIDATIONS phase.
attribute.name: immediate

attribute.description: A name for this component to be rendered to the user. This name should be localized for the user.
attribute.name: label

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the language code used in this element.
attribute.name: lang

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the maximum length of characters allowd in this element.
attribute.name: maxlength

attribute.description: Javascript to execute after this component loses focus.
attribute.name: onblur

attribute.description: Javascript to execute after this component's value has changed, and then it loses focus.
attribute.name: onchange

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when this component is clicked.
attribute.name: onclick

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a double click event occurs.
attribute.name: ondblclick

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when this component gets focus.
attribute.name: onfocus

attribute.name: onkeydown

attribute.name: onkeyup

attribute.name: onmousedown

attribute.name: onmousemove

attribute.name: onmouseover

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when a mouseup event occurs.
attribute.name: onmouseup

attribute.description: Javascript to execute when the user selects this component.
attribute.name: onselect

attribute.description: When true, this causes an attribute to be rendered as readonly="readonly", and prevents the user from changing the value of this component.
attribute.name: readonly

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value of this attribute is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: When this flag is true, and a value has not been specified for this component, then the PROCESS_VALIDATIONS phase will fail and a FacesMessage will be added to the FacesContext for this component.
attribute.name: required

attribute.description: This message or the result of the specified expression, will be used as the text of the validation error message instead of any message that comes from the resulting validation error for this component when required="true" and no value is selected by the user.
attribute.name: requiredMessage

attribute.description: A list of tokens separated by spaces that specify the various WAI-ARIA roles that this component is used by.
attribute.name: role

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the visual length of this element.
attribute.name: size

attribute.description: An integer designating the position in the tabbing order for this component among others, if any.
attribute.name: tabindex

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the title of the element.
attribute.name: title

attribute.description: A method that is executed in the PROCESS_VALIDATIONS phase of the lifecycle. The method must be public, return void, and take three arguments of FacesContext, UIComponent, and Object.
attribute.name: validator

attribute.description: This message or the result of the specified expression, will be used as the text of the validation error message instead of any message that comes from the resulting validation error for this component.
attribute.name: validatorMessage

attribute.description: The value of this component, which is typically bound via EL to a model bean property.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: A method that is executed when the value of this component changes. The method must be public, return void, and take no arguments or one argument of ValueChangeEvent.
attribute.name: valueChangeListener

component.name: OutputText
component.description: OuputText is an HtmlOutputText component that delegates rendering to its JSF renderer.

attribute.description: An EL expression that binds the Java reference to this component in the component tree to a bean property.
attribute.name: binding

attribute.description: The class name of the converter instance that is to be used by this component.
attribute.name: converter

attribute.description: This is an i18n attribute, which designates the reading direction for the attribute. For example, right to left (RTL), or left to right (LTR).
attribute.name: dir

attribute.description: When false, markup will not be escaped. This is true by default.
attribute.name: escape

attribute.description: A unique identifier for this component.
attribute.name: id

attribute.description: __DESCRIPTION__
attribute.name: lang

attribute.description: When this flag is true, this component will be rendered to there response. When false, it will not be rendered to the response. The default value of this attribute is true.
attribute.name: rendered

attribute.description: The css class names that are rendered as the value of the class attribute of the outermost span of this component.
attribute.name: styleClass

attribute.description: The title of the component, which is simply passed through as the html 'title' attribute of this component.
attribute.name: title

attribute.description: This value is used to generate markup used to render the number of remaining characters allowed in the given text input. e.g.: value="There are {0} character(s) remaining."
attribute.name: value

component.name: Tab
component.description: Tab is a panel component that renders nested/child tags as content within itself.

attribute.description: __DESCRIPTION__
attribute.name: label

component.name: TabView
component.description: TabView is an iterator component that renders tabs either statically or dynamically.

attribute.description: The value of this component, which is typically bound via EL to a model bean property.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: The name of the variable that is to be intorduced into the el representing the current iteration.
attribute.name: var

component.name: Rating
component.description: StarRating is an input component that renders a set of stars.

attribute.description: When this flag is true, the component will be disabled, and the user will be unable to intercat with the component.
attribute.name: disabled

attribute.description: A name for this component to be rendered to the user. This name should be localized for the user.
attribute.name: label

attribute.description: HTML passthrough attribute specifying the title of the element.
attribute.name: title

attribute.description: The value of this component, which is typically bound via EL to a model bean property.
attribute.name: value

attribute.description: This message or the result of the specified expression, will be used as the text of the validation error message instead of any message that comes from the resulting validation error for this component when required="true" and no value is selected by the user.

attribute.description: A method that is executed in the PROCESS_VALIDATIONS phase of the lifecycle. The method must be public, return void, and take three arguments of FacesContext, UIComponent, and Object.
attribute.name: validator

attribute.description: This message or the result of the specified expression, will be used as the text of the validation error message instead of any message that comes from the resulting validation error for this component.
attribute.name: validatorMessage
